          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "title": [
              ["In Nodejs the "],
              ["rejectionhandled", [["c"]]],
              [" and "],
              ["unhandledrejection", [["c"]]],
              [" events are called "],
              [
                "rejectionHandled",
                [
                  ["c"],
                  [
                    "a",
                    "https://nodejs.org/api/process.html#process_event_rejectionhandled"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [" and "],
              [
                "unhandledRejection",
                [
                  ["c"],
                  [
                    "a",
                    "https://nodejs.org/api/process.html#process_event_unhandledrejection"
                  ]
                ]
              ],
              [" on "],
              ["process", [["c"]]],
              [", respectively, and have a different signature:"]

              ["The "],
              ["then(fulfill, reject)", [["c"]]],
              [" function looks like it is a shortcut for "],

              [
                ", but it is not, and will cause problems if used interchangeably. One such problem is that the "

              [" handler does not handle errors from the "],

              [" handler. Here is what will happen:"]

                  ["c"],

                    "a",
